page.title: 03Cotswold Flora and Fauna
page.content: This area, being comparatively free of pollution, provides a good habitat for flora and fauna. Farm sprays are the worst problem, but these are now being used with more thought. The Heythrop Hunt take great care of the fox population, and there are many badger earths. A wide variety of wild flowers can be found on the Roman Road, and the outskirts of the quarry also provide an excellent habitat. Butterflies and birds also abound. Hares and partridges are not so prevalent as they were 25 years ago, and this is also attributed to modern farming methods. Kineton Hill land is completely unfertilised and full of natural flora. Nearby land has a large colony of Autumn Crocus.
